ai_flagged_segments: Climate change represents one of the most pressing challenges of our time.
The scientific consensus is clear: human activities have led to unprecedented changes in Earth's climate system.
Global temperatures have risen by an average of 1.1°C since the pre‑industrial era.
आज का समय वह है जब तकनीक की धारा में एक नई लहर तैर रही है—कृत्रिम बुद्धिमत्ता (AI)।
परिणामस्वरूप, AI विश्व भर में डिजिटल परिवर्तन की रणनीतियों का अनिवार्य घटक बन चुका है।
कहते हैं, “सूचना ही शक्ति है,” और AI इस शक्ति को तेज़ी और सटीकता के साथ उजागर करता है।
AI ने उपयोगकर्ता अनुभव को भी वैयक्तिकरण की राह पर ले जाया है।
हर चमकते सोने के सिक्के की तरह, AI के साथ भी कई चुनौतियाँ और नैतिक प्रश्न जुड़े हुए हैं।

details.humanized_text:
# Authentiq: A Friendly Guide to Your All‑In‑One Plagiarism‑Detection Hub  

Whether you’re a student polishing a research paper, a writer vetting a manuscript, or a professional ensuring content originality, Authentiq offers a sleek, user‑friendly dashboard that brings powerful plagiarism‑checking tools right to your fingertips. Below is a walkthrough of the platform’s main sections, how to run a check, and some handy tips to get the most accurate results.

---

## 1. Inside the Dashboard  

When you log into Authentiq, the main navigation bar runs across the top of the screen:

| Section | What It Does |
|---------|--------------|
| Dashboard | Your home base – a quick snapshot of usage and recent activity. |
| New Check | Start a fresh plagiarism scan or AI‑risk assessment. |
| AI Humanizer | Tools for making AI‑generated text sound more natural. |
| History | A log of all past checks (once you’ve run a few). |
| Bulk Upload | Upload multiple files at once for batch processing. |
| Reports | Export detailed findings in PDF or CSV format. |
| Account | Manage your profile, settings, billing, and security. |
| Pro Plan | Upgrade options and usage limits (e.g., “78 / 100 checks used”). |

The Profile submenu lets you tweak personal details, while Settings, Billing, and Security give you full control over your account preferences.

---

## 2. Starting a New Plagiarism Check  

### 2.1 Choose Your Input Method  
- Text Input – Paste or type directly into the large text box.  
- File Upload – Drag‑and‑drop a document (e.g., a research paper on climate change).  

### 2.2 Set the Context  
- Select a Category – Choose the document type that best matches your work (academic paper, blog post, etc.).  
- Language Options –  
  - English – Standard check for English‑only content.  
  - Cross‑Language Detection – Scan against more than 50 languages, perfect for translated material.  

### 2.3 Run the Scan  
After pasting or uploading, click “Run Plagiarism Check.” The platform will instantly count words and characters (starting at 0 for a fresh entry) and begin scanning.

---

## 3. AI Risk Prediction – A Quick Pre‑Check  

Before committing to a full plagiarism scan, Authentiq offers a lightweight AI Risk Prediction. Simply type at least 50 words and the system will estimate how likely the text is to contain AI‑generated content. This helps you decide whether a deeper analysis is necessary.

---

## 4. Reviewing Past Checks  

The Previous Checks tab stores every completed scan. Since this is a brand‑new account, you’ll see “No checks yet.” As you run more checks, each entry will appear here, complete with timestamps and result summaries.

---

## 5. Getting the Best Results – Pro Tips  

1. Aim for 250+ Words – Longer passages give the algorithm more material to compare, boosting accuracy.  
2. Strip Headers & Footers – Remove page numbers, titles, and other repetitive elements that can skew the similarity score.  
3. Enable Cross‑Language Mode – If your document is a translation, turn on the 50+ language comparison to catch hidden matches.  
4. One Document at a Time – Running a single file per check yields more detailed, actionable reports.  

---

## 6. Managing Your Plan  

Authentiq’s Pro Plan provides a quota of checks (e.g., 100 per month). Your current usage—78 / 100 checks used—is displayed prominently on the dashboard, so you can keep an eye on remaining scans and decide when to upgrade.

---

## 7. Wrapping Up  

Authentiq blends a clean, intuitive interface with robust plagiarism‑detection and AI‑risk tools. By following the steps above and applying the best‑practice tips, you’ll be able to verify the originality of your work quickly and confidently—whether you’re tackling a climate‑change research paper or polishing a marketing blog post.

Ready to give it a try? Log in, upload your document, and let Authentiq do the heavy lifting. Happy writing!

# Authentiq: A Friendly Guide to Your All‑In‑One Plagiarism‑Detection Hub  

Whether you’re a student polishing a research paper, a writer vetting a manuscript, or a professional ensuring content originality, Authentiq offers a sleek, user‑friendly dashboard that brings powerful plagiarism‑checking tools right to your fingertips. Below is a walkthrough of the platform’s main sections, how to run a check, and some handy tips to get the most accurate results.

---

## 1. Inside the Dashboard  

When you log into Authentiq, the main navigation bar runs across the top of the screen:

| Section | What It Does |
|---------|--------------|
| Dashboard | Your home base – a quick snapshot of usage and recent activity. |
| New Check | Start a fresh plagiarism scan or AI‑risk assessment. |
| AI Humanizer | Tools for making AI‑generated text sound more natural. |
| History | A log of all past checks (once you’ve run a few). |

| Pro Plan | Upgrade options and usage limits (e.g., “78 / 100 checks used”). |

The Profile submenu lets you tweak personal details, while Settings, Billing, and Security give you full control over your account preferences.

---

## 2. Starting a New Plagiarism Check  

### 2.1 Choose Your Input Method  
- Text Input – Paste or type directly into the large text box.  
- File Upload – Drag‑and‑drop a document (e.g., a research paper on climate change).  

### 2.2 Set the Context  
- Select a Category – Choose the document type that best matches your work (academic paper, blog post, etc.).  
- Language Options –  
  - English – Standard check for English‑only content.  
  - Cross‑Language Detection – Scan against more than 50 languages, perfect for translated material.  

### 2.3 Run the Scan  
After pasting or uploading, click “Run Plagiarism Check.” The platform will instantly count words and characters (starting at 0 for a fresh entry) and begin scanning.

---

## 3. AI Risk Prediction – A Quick Pre‑Check  

Before committing to a full plagiarism scan, Authentiq offers a lightweight AI Risk Prediction. Simply type at least 50 words and the system will estimate how likely the text is to contain AI‑generated content. This helps you decide whether a deeper analysis is necessary.

---

## 4. Reviewing Past Checks  

The Previous Checks tab stores every completed scan. Since this is a brand‑new account, you’ll see “No checks yet.” As you run more checks, each entry will appear here, complete with timestamps and result summaries.

---

## 5. Getting the Best Results – Pro Tips  

1. Aim for 250+ Words – Longer passages give the algorithm more material to compare, boosting accuracy.  
2. Strip Headers & Footers – Remove page numbers, titles, and other repetitive elements that can skew the similarity score.  
3. Enable Cross‑Language Mode – If your document is a translation, turn on the 50+ language comparison to catch hidden matches.  
4. One Document at a Time – Running a single file per check yields more detailed, actionable reports.

## 6. Managing Your Plan  

Authentiq’s Pro Plan provides a quota of checks (e.g., 100 per month). Your current usage—78 / 100 checks used—is displayed prominently on the dashboard, so you can keep an eye on remaining scans and decide when to upgrade.

---

## 7. Wrapping Up  

Authentiq blends a clean, intuitive interface with robust plagiarism‑detection and AI‑risk tools. Ready to give it a try? Log in, upload your document, and let Authentiq do the heavy lifting. Happy writing!
details.humanized_text:
# Authentiq Made Easy: Your All‑In‑One Hub for Plagiarism Checks and AI‑Generated‑Text Tweaks  

Whether you’re polishing a university essay, polishing a manuscript, or just making sure a client’s blog post is 100 % original, you need a tool that’s both powerful and painless to use. That’s where Authentiq comes in. Its clean, intuitive dashboard puts everything you need—plagiarism scans, AI‑risk checks, bulk uploads, and export‑ready reports—right at your fingertips. Below is a friendly walk‑through of the platform, step‑by‑step instructions for running a check, and a handful of insider tips to squeeze the most accuracy out of every scan.

---

## 1. What You’ll See on the Dashboard  

Log in and you’re greeted by a top‑level navigation bar that’s laid out like a well‑organized toolbox:

| Tab | What It Does |
|-----|--------------|
| Dashboard | Your home base – quick stats on usage, recent scans, and remaining quota. |
| New Check | Launch a fresh plagiarism scan or an AI‑risk assessment. |
| AI Humanizer | Turn stiff, AI‑generated prose into something that sounds more natural. |
| History | A chronological log of every scan you’ve run (once you have a few). |
| Bulk Upload | Drop in multiple files for batch processing. |
| Reports | Export detailed findings as PDFs or CSVs. |
| Account | Manage profile, preferences, billing, and security. |
| Pro Plan | Upgrade options and a glance at your check limits (e.g., “78 / 100 checks used”). |

A quick click on Profile lets you edit personal details, while the sub‑menus under Settings, Billing, and Security give you full control over how Authentiq works for you.

---

## 2. Running Your First Plagiarism Check  

### 2.1 Choose How to Feed the Text  

| Option | How It Works |
|--------|--------------|
| Text Input | Paste or type directly into the large text box. |
| File Upload | Drag‑and‑drop a document (Word, PDF, etc.) – perfect for a research paper on climate change, a marketing brief, or anything in between. |

### 2.2 Tell Authentiq What You’re Scanning  

1. Pick a Category – Select the document type that best matches your work (academic paper, blog post, marketing copy, etc.).  
2. Set the Language  
   - English only – Fast, focused scan for English‑only content.  
   - Cross‑Language Detection – Compare against more than 50 languages, ideal for translated material or multilingual projects.  

### 2.3 Hit “Run Plagiarism Check”  

Once your text is in place, click the button. Authentiq instantly counts words and characters (starting at zero for a fresh entry) and launches the scan. Within moments you’ll have a similarity score, highlighted matches, and a downloadable report.

---

## 3. Quick AI‑Risk Prediction (The “Pre‑Check”)  

Not sure whether a passage was generated by an AI model? Authentiq offers a lightweight AI‑risk predictor. Type in at least 50 words, and the tool will give you a probability that the snippet is AI‑generated. It’s a handy way to decide if a deeper, full‑scale analysis is worth the quota.

---

## 4. Looking Back: Your History Tab  

All completed scans land in the History (or Previous Checks) tab. New accounts will naturally show “No checks yet.” As you run more scans, each entry appears with a timestamp, document title, and a brief result summary—making it easy to revisit old reports or compare revisions.

---

## 5. Pro Tips for Spot‑On Results  

1. Shoot for 250+ words – Longer passages give the algorithm more material to match, which translates into higher accuracy.  
2. Trim the fluff – Strip out page numbers, headers, footers, and repetitive boilerplate; they can inflate the similarity score unnecessarily.  
3. Turn on Cross‑Language Mode when needed – If you’re checking a translation, enabling the 50‑plus language comparison catches hidden matches that a monolingual scan would miss.  
4. One file per scan – Running a single document at a time yields clearer, more actionable reports than lumping several files together.  

---

## 6. Keeping an Eye on Your Plan  

Authentiq’s Pro Plan works on a monthly quota (e.g., 100 checks per month). The dashboard prominently displays your current usage—say, 78 / 100 checks used—so you always know how many scans you have left and when it might be time to upgrade.

---

## 7. Bottom Line  

Authentiq marries a sleek, user‑friendly interface with heavyweight plagiarism detection and AI‑risk tools. By following the simple steps above and applying the best‑practice tips, you can verify the originality of anything from a dense climate‑change dissertation to a breezy marketing blog post—quickly, confidently, and without the usual headaches.

Ready to give it a spin? Log in, upload your document, and let Authentiq do the heavy lifting. Happy writing!

# Authentiq Made Easy: Your All‑In‑One Hub for Plagiarism Checks and AI‑Risk Alerts  

Whether you’re polishing a university essay, fine‑tuning a manuscript, or simply making sure a blog post is 100 % original, Authentiq puts a powerful plagiarism‑detection engine right at your fingertips. The platform’s clean, intuitive dashboard makes it feel less like a tech tool and more like a helpful assistant. Below is a friendly walk‑through of the main sections, how to launch a scan, and a few insider tips to squeeze the most accuracy out of every check.

---

## 1. Getting Your Bearings – The Dashboard Overview  

Log in and you’ll be greeted by a horizontal navigation bar that runs across the top of the screen. Each tab does exactly what its name suggests:

| Tab | What You’ll Find |
|-----|------------------|
| Dashboard | Your home base – quick stats on usage, recent scans, and remaining quota. |
| New Check | Start a fresh plagiarism or AI‑risk assessment in seconds. |
| AI Humanizer | Tools that smooth out robotic‑sounding text. |
| History | A chronological log of every scan you’ve run. |
| Bulk Upload | Drop several files at once for batch processing. |
| Reports | Export findings as PDF or CSV for easy sharing. |
| Account | Manage profile details, billing, security, and preferences. |
| Pro Plan | Upgrade options and a clear view of your check limits (e.g., “78 / 100 checks used”). |

A quick click on the Profile submenu lets you edit personal info, while the Settings, Billing, and Security sections give you full control over how the service works for you.

---

## 2. Running Your First Plagiarism Scan  

### 2.1 Pick How You’ll Feed the Text  

- Text Input – Paste or type directly into the spacious text box.  
- File Upload – Drag‑and‑drop a document (Word, PDF, etc.)—perfect for a full research paper or a marketing brief.

### 2.2 Set the Context  

1. Choose a Category – Tell Authentiq what you’re checking (academic paper, blog post, marketing copy, etc.).  
2. Select Language Options  
   - English only – Fast, focused scan for monolingual content.  
   - Cross‑Language Detection – Compare against more than 50 languages, ideal for translated work.

### 2.3 Hit “Run Plagiarism Check”  

Once your text is in place, click the button. Authentiq instantly tallies words and characters (starting at zero for a fresh entry) and launches the scan. Within moments you’ll see a similarity score, highlighted matches, and a downloadable report.

---

## 3. Quick AI‑Risk Prediction – A Light‑Touch Pre‑Check  

Not sure whether your document contains AI‑generated passages? Authentiq offers a lightweight AI Risk Prediction tool. Type in at least 50 words, and the system will give you a probability estimate of AI‑authorship. It’s a handy way to decide if a deeper, full‑scale analysis is worth the check quota.

---

## 4. Digging Into Past Scans  

All completed checks land in the History tab. If you’re just getting started, you’ll see “No checks yet.” As you run more scans, each entry appears with a timestamp, a brief result summary, and a link to the full report—making it easy to revisit past work or track improvements over time.

---

## 5. Pro Tips for Spot‑On Results  

1. Aim for 250+ words – Longer passages give the algorithm more material to compare, which translates to higher accuracy.  
2. Strip out headers & footers – Page numbers, titles, and repeated boilerplate can artificially inflate similarity scores.  
3. Turn on Cross‑Language Mode for translations – If you’re checking a document that started life in another language, enable the 50‑plus language comparison to catch hidden matches.  
4. One file per check – Running a single document at a time yields clearer, more actionable reports than bulk‑checking a mixed bag.

---

## 6. Keeping an Eye on Your Plan  

The Pro Plan hands you a monthly quota of checks (for example, 100 scans per month). Your dashboard displays current usage—say, 78 / 100 checks used—so you always know how many scans you have left and when it might be time to upgrade.

---

## 7. Bottom Line  

Authentiq marries a sleek, user‑friendly interface with robust plagiarism‑detection and AI‑risk capabilities. By following the steps above and applying the quick‑win tips, you can verify the originality of anything from a climate‑change dissertation to a snappy marketing blog post—fast, confidently, and with peace of mind.

Ready to give it a spin? Log in, upload your document, and let Authentiq do the heavy lifting. Happy writing!

details.original_text:
Artificial intelligence is transforming the way modern technology operates across multiple industries. It is being used to automate processes, improve efficiency, and reduce human effort in repetitive tasks. Many companies are adopting artificial intelligence solutions to gain a competitive advantage and enhance productivity. As a result, AI has become an essential component of digital transformation strategies worldwide.
One of the most significant benefits of artificial intelligence is its ability to analyze large amounts of data quickly and accurately. Traditional methods of data analysis often require extensive time and human resources, whereas AI systems can process information in real time. This capability allows organizations to make data-driven decisions more effectively. Consequently, artificial intelligence is widely applied in sectors such as healthcare, finance, education, and marketing.
Artificial intelligence also plays an important role in improving user experiences through personalization. Recommendation systems, chatbots, and virtual assistants are examples of AI-powered tools that interact with users intelligently. These systems are designed to learn from user behavior and adapt accordingly. Therefore, businesses can deliver more relevant and customized services to their customers.
Despite its advantages, artificial intelligence presents certain challenges and ethical concerns. Issues such as data privacy, algorithmic bias, and job displacement are frequently discussed. It is important for organizations and policymakers to address these concerns responsibly. By implementing ethical guidelines and transparent practices, artificial intelligence can be developed and used in a manner that benefits society as a whole.
details.humanized_text:
# Inteligencia Artificial y su Impacto en la Transformación Digital de la Industria  

## Resumen  
La inteligencia artificial (IA) está redefiniendo la forma en que la tecnología moderna funciona en múltiples sectores. Su capacidad para automatizar procesos, aumentar la eficiencia y reducir el esfuerzo humano en tareas repetitivas la ha convertido en un elemento esencial de las estrategias de transformación digital a nivel global. Este trabajo revisa los principales beneficios de la IA —especialmente su rapidez y precisión en el análisis de datos—, su aplicación en la personalización de la experiencia del usuario y los retos éticos que plantea, como la privacidad de los datos, el sesgo algorítmico y la posible pérdida de empleos. Se discuten recomendaciones para que empresas y reguladores adopten prácticas responsables que maximicen el valor social de la IA.

## 1. Introducción  
En los últimos años, la IA ha pasado de ser una curiosidad académica a un motor clave de la competitividad empresarial. Cada vez más organizaciones la incorporan para obtener ventajas estratégicas y mejorar su productividad. Esta tendencia se refleja en la inclusión de la IA dentro de los planes de transformación digital de compañías de todo el mundo.

## 2. Beneficios clave de la IA  

### 2.1 Análisis de datos a gran escala  
Una de las virtudes más destacadas de la IA es su habilidad para procesar volúmenes masivos de información de forma rápida y exacta. Mientras que los métodos tradicionales de análisis pueden requerir semanas de trabajo y un gran número de analistas, los sistemas basados en IA pueden extraer patrones y generar insights en tiempo real. Esta agilidad permite a las organizaciones tomar decisiones fundamentadas en datos de manera más eficaz.

### 2.2 Aplicaciones en sectores estratégicos  
Gracias a esta capacidad, la IA se ha extendido a áreas como la salud (diagnóstico asistido), finanzas (detección de fraudes), educación (plataformas adaptativas) y marketing (segmentación de audiencias). En cada caso, la IA ayuda a optimizar procesos y a ofrecer soluciones más precisas.

## 3. Mejora de la experiencia del usuario  

### 3.1 Personalización mediante sistemas de recomendación  
Los sistemas de recomendación, los chatbots y los asistentes virtuales son ejemplos claros de cómo la IA puede interactuar de forma inteligente con los usuarios. Estos instrumentos aprenden del comportamiento del cliente y ajustan sus respuestas o sugerencias en consecuencia, lo que se traduce en servicios más relevantes y personalizados.

### 3.2 Impacto en la relación empresa‑cliente  
Al ofrecer experiencias adaptadas a las necesidades individuales, las empresas pueden fortalecer la lealtad del cliente y diferenciarse de la competencia.

## 4. Desafíos y consideraciones éticas  

### 4.1 Privacidad y protección de datos  
El manejo de grandes cantidades de información personal plantea riesgos de privacidad. Es fundamental que las organizaciones implementen políticas claras de gestión de datos y cumplan con la normativa vigente.

### 4.2 Sesgo algorítmico  
Los algoritmos pueden reproducir o amplificar sesgos presentes en los datos de entrenamiento, lo que lleva a decisiones injustas. La auditoría continua y la inclusión de equipos multidisciplinarios son pasos necesarios para mitigar este problema.

### 4.3 Impacto laboral  
La automatización de tareas repetitivas puede generar desplazamiento de puestos de trabajo. Sin embargo, también abre oportunidades para roles más creativos y estratégicos, siempre que se acompañe de programas de capacitación y reconversión profesional.

## 5. Recomendaciones para una IA responsable  

1. Establecer guías éticas claras que definan principios de transparencia, equidad y responsabilidad.  
2. Fomentar la transparencia algorítmica, permitiendo a los usuarios comprender cómo se toman las decisiones automatizadas.  
3. Implementar mecanismos de supervisión que detecten y corrijan sesgos o errores en tiempo real.  
4. Promover la educación y la capacitación de la fuerza laboral para adaptarse a los nuevos roles que surgen con la IA.  

## 6. Conclusiones  
La inteligencia artificial se ha consolidado como un pilar indispensable de la transformación digital, ofreciendo ventajas competitivas al acelerar el análisis de datos y personalizar la interacción con los usuarios. No obstante, su adopción debe acompañarse de una gestión ética y responsable que aborde los riesgos asociados a la privacidad, el sesgo y el empleo. Al seguir las recomendaciones propuestas, empresas y reguladores pueden asegurar que la IA genere beneficios sostenibles para la sociedad.

## Referencias (selección)  
- Russell, S. & Norvig, P. (2020). Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach. Pearson.  
- European Commission. (2021). Ethics Guidelines for Trustworthy AI.  
- McKinsey & Company. (2022). The State of AI in 2022.  

---  

Nota: Este documento está pensado como una versión simplificada y accesible de un artículo académico, orientado a lectores que buscan una visión clara y práctica del papel de la IA en la transformación digital.

details.original_text:
Artificial intelligence is transforming the way modern technology operates across multiple industries. It is being used to automate processes, improve efficiency, and reduce human effort in repetitive tasks. Many companies are adopting artificial intelligence solutions to gain a competitive advantage and enhance productivity. As a result, AI has become an essential component of digital transformation strategies worldwide.
One of the most significant benefits of artificial intelligence is its ability to analyze large amounts of data quickly and accurately. Traditional methods of data analysis often require extensive time and human resources, whereas AI systems can process information in real time. This capability allows organizations to make data-driven decisions more effectively. Consequently, artificial intelligence is widely applied in sectors such as healthcare, finance, education, and marketing.
Artificial intelligence also plays an important role in improving user experiences through personalization. Recommendation systems, chatbots, and virtual assistants are examples of AI-powered tools that interact with users intelligently. These systems are designed to learn from user behavior and adapt accordingly. Therefore, businesses can deliver more relevant and customized services to their customers.
Despite its advantages, artificial intelligence presents certain challenges and ethical concerns. Issues such as data privacy, algorithmic bias, and job displacement are frequently discussed. It is important for organizations and policymakers to address these concerns responsibly. By implementing ethical guidelines and transparent practices, artificial intelligence can be developed and used in a manner that benefits society as a whole.
details.humanized_text:
# कृत्रिम बुद्धिमत्ता: डिजिटल युग का परिवर्तनकारी शक्ति

## परिचय  
आज का समय वह है जब तकनीक की धारा में एक नई लहर तैर रही है—कृत्रिम बुद्धिमत्ता (AI)। यह केवल एक तकनीकी उन्नति नहीं, बल्कि वह प्रेरक शक्ति है जो विभिन्न उद्योगों को पुनः परिभाषित कर रही है। प्रक्रिया‑स्वचालन, कार्य‑कुशलता में सुधार और दोहराव वाले कार्यों में मानवीय प्रयास को घटाने के लिए AI ने अपने पंख फैला दिए हैं। इस कारण, कंपनियां अब प्रतिस्पर्धात्मक बढ़त हासिल करने और उत्पादनशीलता को नई ऊँचाइयों पर ले जाने के लिए AI‑आधारित समाधान अपनाने में कोई कसर नहीं छोड़ रही हैं। परिणामस्वरूप, AI विश्व भर में डिजिटल परिवर्तन की रणनीतियों का अनिवार्य घटक बन चुका है।

## डेटा‑विश्लेषण में AI का क्रांतिकारी प्रभाव  
कहते हैं, “सूचना ही शक्ति है,” और AI इस शक्ति को तेज़ी और सटीकता के साथ उजागर करता है। पारम्परिक डेटा‑विश्लेषण अक्सर महीनों‑सप्ताहों तक का समय और बड़े मानव संसाधन की मांग करता था। वहीं, AI सिस्टम वास्तविक‑समय में विशाल मात्रा में डेटा को प्रोसेस कर, सूक्ष्मतम पैटर्न को भी पकड़ लेते हैं। इस तेज़ी के कारण, संगठनों को अब डेटा‑आधारित निर्णय लेने में पहले से अधिक आत्मविश्वास मिलता है। स्वास्थ्य‑सेवा, वित्त, शिक्षा और विपणन जैसे क्षेत्रों में AI का उपयोग इस बात का प्रमाण है कि कैसे “बड़े डेटा” को “बुद्धिमान निर्णय” में बदला जा रहा है।

## व्यक्तिगत अनुभव की नई परिभाषा  
AI ने उपयोगकर्ता अनुभव को भी वैयक्तिकरण की राह पर ले जाया है। सिफ़ारिश प्रणाली, चैटबॉट, वर्चुअल असिस्टेंट—इन सभी उपकरणों में वह “स्मार्ट” परत है, जो उपयोगकर्ता के व्यवहार को सीखकर उसे अनुकूलित करता है। उदाहरण स्वरूप, एक ऑनलाइन शॉपिंग साइट पर आपके पिछले खरीदारी इतिहास के आधार पर सुझाए गए उत्पाद, या एक बैंकिंग ऐप में आपके खर्च के पैटर्न के अनुसार तैयार किए गए बजट सुझाव—ये सब AI की सूक्ष्म समझ का नतीजा हैं। इस प्रकार, व्यवसाय अब अपने ग्राहकों को न केवल अधिक प्रासंगिक, बल्कि व्यक्तिगत रूप से तैयार सेवाएँ प्रदान कर पा रहे हैं।

## चुनौतियाँ और नैतिक दुविधाएँ  
हर चमकते सोने के सिक्के की तरह, AI के साथ भी कई चुनौतियाँ और नैतिक प्रश्न जुड़े हुए हैं। डेटा की गोपनीयता, एल्गोरिदमिक पक्षपात, और रोजगार में संभावित विस्थापन—इन मुद्दों पर लगातार बहस होती रहती है। इसलिए, न केवल कंपनियों को बल्कि नीति निर्माताओं को भी इन चिंताओं को गंभीरता से लेना चाहिए। नैतिक दिशानिर्देश, पारदर्शी कार्यप्रणाली और जवाबदेह AI विकास के मूलभूत स्तंभ बनते हैं। जब इन सिद्धांतों को अपनाया जाता है, तो AI समाज के लिए एक सशक्त सहयोगी बन सकता है, न कि एक असहज बोझ।

## निष्कर्ष  
कृत्रिम बुद्धिमत्ता ने डिजिटल परिवर्तन की राह में एक नई दिशा स्थापित की है—जहाँ डेटा को तेज़ी से समझा जाता है, उपयोगकर्ता अनुभव को व्यक्तिगत बनाया जाता है, और व्यवसायों को प्रतिस्पर्धात्मक लाभ मिलता है। लेकिन इस शक्ति को संतुलित रूप से उपयोग करने के लिए नैतिक जिम्मेदारी और सामाजिक समझ की आवश्यकता है। जब हम AI को मानवता के हित में, पारदर्शिता और न्याय के साथ विकसित करेंगे, तभी यह तकनीक वास्तव में एक “सहायक” बन पाएगी, जो न केवल उद्योगों को, बल्कि सम्पूर्ण समाज को समृद्धि की ओर ले जाएगी।

ai_flagged_segments: "Your task: Refactor and enhance the plagiarism checking pipeline step-by-step WITHOUT breaking existing APIs or frontend contracts."
"Create a utility function that: - Converts text to lowercase - Removes extra whitespace - Removes punctuation - Normalizes unicode characters"
"Implement fast local plagiarism heuristics: - Sentence tokenization - N-gram (3–5) shingles - Jaccard similarity - TF‑IDF cosine similarity"
"If similarity score < 30%, immediately return: { \"plagiarism_level\": \"Low\", \"confidence\": \"High\", \"source\": \"Local analysis\", \"api_used\": false }"
"Generate SHA256 hash of normalized text - Check local storage/database for an existing result - If found, return cached result immediately"
"Only if local similarity ≥ 30% AND cache miss: - Split text into logical chunks (max 400–600 tokens) - Send ONLY suspicious chunks to the external LLM API - Never send the full document blindly"

"DO NOT ask the LLM for an exact plagiarism percentage. Instead, prompt the AI to return: - originality_level: High / Medium / Low - similarity_range: (e.g., 40–60%) - reasoning (short explanation) - suspected patterns (academic, SEO, paraphrased, copied)"

"Standardize API output as: { \"originality_level\": \"...\", \"similarity_range\": \"...\", \"confidence\": \"...\", \"analysis_summary\": \"...\", \"matched_patterns\": [...], \"api_used\": true/false }"
"Before API calls: - Check user plan limits (daily tokens / words) - If exceeded, block request with HTTP 402 and message: \"Daily plagiarism limit reached. Upgrade plan.\""
"Log every check: - user_id - text_length - hash - api_used - result_summary - timestamp - Ensure this logging is non‑blocking."
"Do NOT remove existing endpoints - Do NOT introduce breaking changes - Code must be clean, modular, and production‑ready - Avoid circular imports - Prefer async‑safe operations"
details.analysis_summary: Passed local heuristic checks. Content seems highly original.

ai_flagged_segments: You are a senior backend engineer and SaaS product architect.
Context: I am building an AI‑powered SaaS platform (FastAPI backend + Next.js frontend) that performs plagiarism checking, AI‑content detection, and AI text humanization.
Currently, plagiarism detection is weak and overly dependent on an external LLM API.
Your task: Refactor and enhance the plagiarism checking pipeline step‑by‑step WITHOUT breaking existing APIs or frontend contracts.
Follow the instructions below EXACTLY and implement them sequentially.
Create a utility function that: – Converts text to lowercase – Removes extra whitespace – Removes punctuation – Normalizes unicode characters.
Implement fast local plagiarism heuristics: – Sentence tokenization – N‑gram (3–5) shingles – Jaccard similarity – TF‑IDF cosine similarity.
Your task: Refactor and enhance the plagiarism checking pipeline step‑by‑step WITHOUT breaking existing APIs or frontend contracts.
Follow the instructions below EXACTLY and implement them sequentially.
Create a utility function that:
Converts text to lowercase
Removes extra whitespace
Removes punctuation
Normalizes unicode characters
Implement fast local plagiarism heuristics:
Sentence tokenization
N‑gram (3–5) shingles
Jaccard similarity
TF‑IDF cosine similarity
Only if local similarity ≥ 30% AND cache miss:
Split text into logical chunks (max 400–600 tokens)
Send ONLY suspicious chunks to the external LLM API
Never send the full document blindly
DO NOT ask the LLM for an exact plagiarism percentage.
Standardize API output as:
Before API calls:
Check user plan limits (daily tokens / words)
If exceeded, block request with HTTP 402 and message: "Daily plagiarism limit reached. Upgrade plan."
“Authentiq is an AI‑powered SaaS platform that specializes in content authenticity and modification.”
“It lets users check text or documents for plagiarism, detect if content was generated by AI, and “humanize” AI text to bypass detectors.”
“Free: Basic plagiarism heuristic checks, low word count limits, limited AI chat.”
“Paid (Pro/Enterprise): Deep web‑scraping plagiarism checks, access to the premium “Humanizer” API, document uploads (PDF/Docx), and significantly higher token/word limits.”

“A new user signs up with email/password: Frontend (Sign up form) → Backend API (/api/auth/register) → Logic (Validates fields) → Storage (Writes to local_users.json) → Response (Success/Error) → Frontend (Redirects to login).”

“User runs plagiarism check: Frontend (Pastes text/uploads) → Backend API (/api/check-plagiarism) → Logic (Sends text & strict prompts to Groq API) → Response (Groq returns % score) → Storage (Logs activity to local_user_activities.json) → Frontend (Displays % and sources).”
“Data Validation: Handled effortlessly by FastAPI through Pydantic models (e.g., PlagiarismRequest). If the frontend sends bad data, FastAPI intercepts it with a 422 Error before code execution.”
“Race conditions in local_db.py: Writing to a single JSON file synchronously will cause file corruption under moderate traffic.”
“Blocking I/O: Reading .json files inside async endpoints without asyncio file adapters can block the event loop.”

details.analysis_summary: The text follows a common template for SaaS product briefs and includes generic sections (overview, user personas, problem statement, workflow steps) that appear in many similar tool descriptions, indicating moderate overlap but also original specifics about Authentiq.
matched_patterns: Repeated section headings like 'What this software does' and 'Who the users are'
Standard workflow enumeration with API endpoint patterns
Common phrasing about free vs paid limits and AI detection features
details.original_text:
🔹 PART 1: HIGH-LEVEL PRODUCT OVERVIEW
What this software does: Authentiq is an AI-powered SaaS platform that specializes in content authenticity and modification. It lets users check text or documents for plagiarism, detect if content was generated by AI, and "humanize" AI text to bypass detectors. It also offers a built-in AI chat assistant.

Who the users are:

Students & Academics: Checking papers before submission to ensure originality.
Content Creators & Writers: Testing SEO articles to ensure they won't be penalized by Google's AI spam updates.
Professionals/Enterprise: Verifying the authenticity of reports, legal documents, or candidate assignments.
What problems it solves: It solves the modern problem of trusting digital content. With LLMs (like ChatGPT) everywhere, it's difficult to know if a human wrote something. If it was AI-generated, Authentiq provides a tool to restructure it to sound naturally human.

Free vs. Paid Limits (Conceptualized System):

Free: Basic plagiarism heuristic checks, low word count limits, limited AI chat.
Paid (Pro/Enterprise): Deep web-scraping plagiarism checks, access to the premium "Humanizer" API, document uploads (PDF/Docx), and significantly higher token/word limits.
🔹 PART 2: COMPLETE WORKFLOW (END-TO-END)
1. A new user signs up with email/password: Frontend (Sign up form) → Backend API (/api/auth/register) → Logic (Validates fields) → Storage (Writes to local_users.json) → Response (Success/Error) → Frontend (Redirects to login).

2. A user signs in with Google OAuth: (Currently mocked/failing in local mode due to Supabase removal) Frontend (Clicks Google) → Backend API (/api/auth/google/login - currently returns 501) → Future: Triggers Supabase OAuth flow → Storage (Supabase syncs to users table) → Frontend (Receives session JWT).

3. User lands on dashboard: Frontend (/dashboard) → Backend API (/api/dashboard/stats & /api/user/me) → Logic (Verifies Bearer token against local_users.json) → Storage (Reads user_stats.json) → Response (Delivers stats) → Frontend (Renders charts/UI).

4. User runs plagiarism check: Frontend (Pastes text/uploads) → Backend API (/api/check-plagiarism) → Logic (Sends text & strict prompts to Groq API) → Response (Groq returns % score) → Storage (Logs activity to local_user_activities.json) → Frontend (Displays % and sources).

5. User runs AI detection: Frontend (Included in plagiarism payload) → Backend API (Calls Groq with AI-detection prompt) → Logic (Parses output for sentences and confidence %) → Response → Frontend (Highlights AI sentences).

6. User runs humanizer: Frontend (Selects tone/complexity) → Backend API (/api/humanizer) → Logic (Calls Groq to rewrite text using instructions) → Logic (Calculates improvement score) → Storage (Logs activity) → Response (Returns new text) → Frontend (Displays diff).

7. User uses chat / AI tools: Frontend (Chat widget) → Backend API (/api/ai-chat) → Logic (Checks moderation keywords, calls Groq API) → Response (Returns AI text) → Frontend (Shows chat bubble).

🔹 PART 3: BACKEND ARCHITECTURE (Python / FastAPI)
Your backend is currently a monolithic FastAPI application.


main.py
 functionality: This is the entry point. It initializes FastAPI, configures CORS, and registers all API endpoints directly (@app.get, @app.post).
Authentication: Handled manually in /api/auth/login and /me. It extracts the Authorization: Bearer <token> header, then passes it to 

local_db.py
 to check against the JSON file.
OAuth: Temporarily stubbed with a 501 Not Implemented error since the local JSON database cannot independently handle external OAuth redirects.
AI Processing: Endpoints like /api/check-plagiarism don't do the heavy lifting. They import asynchronous functions from 

ai_model.py
 and await the results.
Activity logging: Executed linearly inside the endpoint blocks just before returning the HTTP response (e.g., local_db.log_activity).
Data Validation: Handled effortlessly by FastAPI through Pydantic models (e.g., PlagiarismRequest). If the frontend sends bad data, FastAPI intercepts it with a 422 Error before code execution.
Error Locations: Network timeouts with Groq, file parsing errors (e.g., corrupted PDFs in /api/upload-file), or JSON read/write locking issues.
🔹 PART 4: FILE & MODULE CONNECTION MAP

main.py
 → The controller. Defines routes and connects HTTP requests to Python functions.

ai_model.py
 → The engine. Contains all the prompts, httpx logic to talk to Groq, and heuristic fallback logic (regex/math) if API keys fail.

models.py
 → the schematics. Contains Pydantic classes (like UserCreate, PlagiarismResult). Depends on nothing. Imported by 

main.py
 and 

ai_model.py
.

config.py
 → The settings. Reads 

.env
 and exports constants.

local_db.py
 → The current database driver. Contains logic to read, append, and rewrite the JSON files.

supabase_client.py
 → The future database driver. (Currently minimized/disabled).
JSON DB files (

local_users.json
, 

local_user_activities.json
) → Flat text files acting as tables.
Dependencies: 

main.py
 depends on practically everything (models, config, local_db, ai_model). ai_model depends on config and models. Note: You are currently avoiding circular imports, which is great.

🔹 PART 5: DATABASE DESIGN (CURRENT + FUTURE)
Current (Local JSON DB)
Data stored: Users (email, hashed password, raw token), Activities (type of check, results, timestamp), Stats (total checks).
Persistence: Relies on Python's native open(file, 'w') to overwrite the JSON files every time a new action occurs.
Restart behavior: Data survives server restarts because it is written to disk.
Limitations (CRITICAL): This will break under concurrent load. If two users sign up at the exact same millisecond, Python might corrupt the JSON file via race conditions.
Future (Supabase)
Tables Needed:
users (managed by Supabase Auth)
profiles (links to auth.users, stores name, active plan ID)
subscriptions (tracks Stripe/payment limits)
activity_logs (stores check_type, tokens_used, timestamp)
documents (stores past checks so users can view history)
OAuth Sync: Supabase handles Google login perfectly. You will set a Postgres Trigger on the auth.users table to automatically insert a row into your public profiles table upon creation.
🔹 PART 6: AUTHENTICATION SYSTEM CLARITY
Email/Password: You collect credentials, hash the password (hopefully/should be doing this), and store it. When they log in, you generate a string (Token) and hand it to the client.
Google OAuth: A completely different flow. The user trusts Google, Google verifies their identity, and Google hands you (the Server) an identity token.
JWT & Sessions: Currently, you are using "dumb tokens" (random strings saved in JSON). In the future (Supabase), the token will be a JWT. A JWT contains user data cryptographically signed. You won't "look it up" in the database; you will verify its mathematical signature.
Frontend Storage: The frontend stores this token (likely in localStorage or cookies) and attaches it to the Authorization header on every request.
Protected Routes: The frontend checks if the token exists. If not, it forces a redirect to /login. The backend checks the header on secure endpoints; if missing/invalid, it throws a 401 Unauthorized.
🔹 PART 7: FRONTEND ↔ BACKEND CONNECTION
Page logic: Next.js pages (like /dashboard/humanizer) render the UI and fire API fetches to your FastAPI server running on http://localhost:8000/api/....
Fetch execution: A user clicking "Check" triggers a React asynchronous function that POSTs the text to FastAPI.
CORS: FastAPI is properly configured (CORSMiddleware) to accept requests originating from the Next.js port (e.g., localhost:3000).
Error Handling: If FastAPI returns 500 (e.g., Groq is down), the frontend catch block captures it and likely triggers a UI Toast notification (via sonner or toaster) so the user isn't left hanging.
🔹 PART 8: AI COST & TOKEN OPTIMIZATION
Why tokens exhaust: Groq charges (or rate-limits) based on input and output tokens. Sending a whole essay to check for plagiarism consumes a massive amount of input tokens.

Optimization Strategies:

Caching (Hash Matching): Before sending text to Groq, hash the text (MD5/SHA256). Look it up in your database. If someone previously checked this exact text, return the cached result instantly for $0.
Chunking / Pre-filtering: Don't send 5,000 words. Split it, or use a cheap local Python library (nltk/spacy) to filter out generic sentences before querying the LLM.
Usage Limits: Enforce daily token limits in the database. Subtract tokens per request, intercepting with a 402 Payment Required if they hit zero.
🔹 PART 9: FUTURE DESKTOP APP (THE BIG PLAY)
To bring this to Windows and run AI locally (saving API costs and improving privacy):

Architecture: Use Tauri (Rust + React) or Electron. Tauri is recommended as it's incredibly lightweight for Windows.
The Backend: You can package your existing FastAPI server using PyInstaller. The desktop app launches this hidden server on a local port (e.g., 127.0.0.1:8000) and the React UI speaks to it exactly as it does now!
Local Models: Integrate Ollama or Llama.cpp into the Python backend. Add logic to 

ai_model.py
: If running locally, route the prompt to localhost:11434 (Ollama) instead of Groq API.
Offline Mode: The desktop app creates a local SQLite database (instead of JSON). Supabase data syncs down when online so users can view history offline.
🔹 PART 10: PROBLEMS, RISKS & FIXES
Immediate Fixes Required:

Race conditions in 

local_db.py
: Writing to a single JSON file synchronously will cause file corruption under moderate traffic.
Blocking I/O: Reading 

.json
 files inside async endpoints without asyncio file adapters can block the event loop.
Fake AI Plagiarism: Currently, if the Groq key is missing, the fallback math generates a random percentage score = (hash_value % 25) + random.uniform(0, 15). This is highly unpredictable and unethical if users are paying for accurate results.
Scalability Risks:

In-memory logic: Python holding massive documents in memory to parse them will spike RAM on small Vercel/Render instances.
Deployment: Vercel is meant for Next.js/Serverless Node. Deploying stateful Python (that writes to disk) on Vercel is a bad idea due to serverless ephemeral file systems. Connect a real Postgres DB (Supabase) before deploying!
🔹 PART 11: CLEAN RECOMMENDED ARCHITECTURE
Your Roadmap from Phase 1 (Now) to Phase 3 (Scale):

Step 1. Folder Restructure (ASAP):

text
backend/
├── app/
│   ├── main.py
│   ├── core/           # config.py, auth logic
│   ├── database/       # Supabase connections
│   ├── routers/        # /ai, /auth, /users (Split main.py up!)
│   ├── services/       # ai_model.py (business logic)
│   └── models/         # Pydantic models
Action: Move endpoints out of 

main.py
 using APIRouter.

Step 2. Database Migration: Rip out the JSON files entirely. Transition strictly to Supabase Postgres. Use asyncpg or Supabase's Python SDK. This completely eliminates race conditions and allows for real relational queries.

Step 3. Deployment:

Frontend: Vercel (Perfect for Next.js).
Backend: Render or Railway (Do not put the FastAPI app on Vercel, it needs a persistable environment and generous timeout limits for LLM tasks).
Step 4. Local App Build: Once the web version is flawless, wrap the exact same Next.js code using Tauri, bundle Ollama.exe as a sidecar, and ship it as a .msi Windows installer.

details.original_text:
You are a senior backend engineer and SaaS product architect.

Context:
I am building an AI-powered SaaS platform (FastAPI backend + Next.js frontend) that performs plagiarism checking, AI-content detection, and AI text humanization.

Currently, plagiarism detection is weak and overly dependent on an external LLM API. I want you to upgrade it to a production-grade, cost-optimized, multi-layer plagiarism detection system.

Your task:
Refactor and enhance the plagiarism checking pipeline step-by-step WITHOUT breaking existing APIs or frontend contracts.

Follow the instructions below EXACTLY and implement them sequentially.

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 1: INPUT NORMALIZATION
────────────────────────────────────
Create a utility function that:
- Converts text to lowercase
- Removes extra whitespace
- Removes punctuation
- Normalizes unicode characters

This function must be reusable and run before any plagiarism logic.

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 2: LOCAL SIMILARITY HEURISTICS (NO API)
────────────────────────────────────
Implement fast local plagiarism heuristics:
- Sentence tokenization
- N-gram (3–5) shingles
- Jaccard similarity
- TF-IDF cosine similarity

Rules:
- If similarity score < 30%, immediately return:
  {
    "plagiarism_level": "Low",
    "confidence": "High",
    "source": "Local analysis",
    "api_used": false
  }

DO NOT call any external API in this case.

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 3: TEXT HASHING & CACHE
────────────────────────────────────
Before calling any external API:
- Generate SHA256 hash of normalized text
- Check local storage/database for an existing result
- If found, return cached result immediately

Store:
- hash
- original text length
- plagiarism result
- timestamp

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 4: CONTROLLED EXTERNAL API CALL
────────────────────────────────────
Only if local similarity ≥ 30% AND cache miss:
- Split text into logical chunks (max 400–600 tokens)
- Send ONLY suspicious chunks to the external LLM API
- Never send the full document blindly

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 5: AI PROMPT REWRITE (IMPORTANT)
────────────────────────────────────
DO NOT ask the LLM for an exact plagiarism percentage.

Instead, prompt the AI to return:
- originality_level: High / Medium / Low
- similarity_range: (e.g., 40–60%)
- reasoning (short explanation)
- suspected patterns (academic, SEO, paraphrased, copied)

This avoids fake precision and improves trust.

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 6: FINAL RESPONSE FORMAT
────────────────────────────────────
Standardize API output as:

{
  "originality_level": "...",
  "similarity_range": "...",
  "confidence": "...",
  "analysis_summary": "...",
  "matched_patterns": [...],
  "api_used": true/false
}

Ensure backward compatibility with existing frontend fields.

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 7: USAGE LIMIT HOOK
────────────────────────────────────
Before API calls:
- Check user plan limits (daily tokens / words)
- If exceeded, block request with HTTP 402 and message:
  "Daily plagiarism limit reached. Upgrade plan."

────────────────────────────────────
STEP 8: LOGGING & AUDIT
────────────────────────────────────
Log every check:
- user_id
- text_length
- hash
- api_used
- result_summary
- timestamp

Ensure this logging is non-blocking.

────────────────────────────────────
CONSTRAINTS
────────────────────────────────────
- Do NOT remove existing endpoints
- Do NOT introduce breaking changes
- Code must be clean, modular, and production-ready
- Avoid circular imports
- Prefer async-safe operations

Goal:
Reduce external API usage by at least 50% while increasing result credibility and scalability.

Proceed step-by-step. Explain code decisions briefly in comments.

- Removes punctuation

Angkor Bayon Temple

c) What is the name of an eagle’s nest? → Eyrie
d) Who was the first captain of Independent India’s Olympic football team? → Talimeren Ao
e) Name the youngest and first sportsperson to receive Bharat Ratna → Sachin Tendulkar

Q.1. Match the Following

 Q.2. Name the Famous Personality
a) Britain’s first woman doctor and champion of women’s rights
→ Elizabeth Garrett Anderson
b) Jamaican nurse who looked after soldiers in the Crimean War
→ Mary Seacole
c) Prison reformer and pioneer of nurse training
→ Florence Nightingale
d) Actor known for innocent natural acting and Dadasaheb Phalke Award recipient
→ Charlie Chaplin
e) Famous comic double act (small thin confused & big fat irritable)
→ Laurel and Hardy

 Q.3. Name the Amazing Places Around the World
Statue of Liberty (USA)
Great Wall of China
Opera House
Basils Cathedral
Angkor Bayon Temple

 Q.4. Answer the Following
a) Which nutrient is known as the sunshine vitamin?
→ Vitamin D
b) What creatures make chalk, tubes, stones and shells?
→ Coral
c) What is the name of an eagle’s nest?
→ Eyrie
d) Who was the first captain of Independent India’s Olympic football team?
→ Talimeren Ao
e) Name the youngest and first sportsperson to receive Bharat Ratna
→ Sachin Tendulkar
